entry.title: Re: TRM Fields in app Display Line Items in General Ledge...
entry.content:
Hello @FabioGG 

Thanks for the question. Here is what might be possible and how to proceed.

What you should do
Display Line Items in General Ledger (App ID F2217) is developed using the CDS view C_JournalEntryItemBrowser and primarily presents fields from ACDOCA. Additional fields from related views may be incorporated if the association is 0-1 or 1-1

How to add fields key-user extensibility?
If the TRM fields you need are part of ACDOCA or an eligible association of C_JournalEntryItemBrowser, you can add them via Custom Fields and Logic:

Create the custom fields in the business context Journal Entry Item (or relevant GL context).

Enable usage for the app Display Line Items in General Ledger (F2217).

Publish and then add the fields via the app’s column settings. SAP Help Portal-Custom Fields for Journal Entries Used in G/L Accounting

Known limitation: App ID F2217 does not display fields that only exist in BSEG/BKPF, that is, App ID F2218 Display Line Item Entry. If a field appears in F2218 but not in F2217, it’s because F2217 reads ACDOCA (and specific associations), while F2218 reads BSEG/BKPF. SAP Support Portal-2699769 - Field Display in app Display Line Items in General Ledger


The listed fields, such as YY1_FinancialInstrCharact and YY1_TermStartDate, use the YY1 namespace (custom). To display them in F2217, they must either be persisted on ACDOCA or an associated view, eligible as per the above, and enabled for F2217 via Custom Fields and Logic.


If they are stored only in TRM tables that are not linked to C_JournalEntryItemBrowser with 0-1 or 1-1 cardinality, they won’t be accessible in F2217 by default. In such cases, consider a data-source extension where supported or using an alternative reporting application built on a CDS view that includes those TRM attributes. SAP Support Portal-3218239 - Display Line Items in General Ledger is not showing Submitter, Approver, Reviewer


If you attempt to add such fields in Display Line-Item Entry F2218, be aware that this app is not registered for extensibility. The suggested approach is to extend F2217 instead, as explained above. SAP Support Portal-3427372 - Unable to add the custom fields in "Display Line Item Entry" app - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Let me know how it goes

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Collaborative Notification - One notification, shared visibility, faster outcomes.
entry.content:
No company is an island!!!

Our vision is a world where every asset runs reliably because Operators, Contractors, and OEMs collaborate seamlessly on a single trusted network. By connecting all parties in one shared platform, we make it easier to coordinate maintenance activities, share real-time status updates, and quickly address issues. This seamless collaboration reduces communication gaps, accelerates decision-

making, and ensures that every asset performs at its best — delivering reliability and efficiency across operations.

The new Collaborative Notification feature brings this vision to life by providing shared network statuses within notifications. Instead of relying on scattered emails and chats, operators, contractors, and OEMs now gain a structured, integrated view of each maintenance activity’s progress directly in the existing notification screens. This makes it easy to identify rejected or completed work that requires follow-up, ensures faster alignment across teams, and drives more efficient, transparent maintenance execution — turning seamless collaboration from a goal into a daily reality.

Here’s a storyboard illustrating how the Collaborative Notification works.

Personas

 

 

Issue Detection and Reporting

 

 

Execution & Post-Work Review

Within SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration, we have also introduced a new status concept to track the full life cycle of maintenance notifications. This enhancement significantly improves our ability to monitor, manage, and facilitate collaboration over the network, providing greater transparency and driving better overall performance.

Initiation Phase

During the Initiation phase, an operator creates a maintenance notification for a piece of equipment or a functional location, and then shares it with the Service Contractor.

Once shared, the notification becomes available on the BNAC tenant of the service contractor, where the Service Planner can view all incoming requests and proceed to the next phase: screening.

At this stage, the notification is automatically assigned an initial status of ‘Open’, indicating that it is ready for further processing.

Screening Phase

During the Screening phase, the Service Planner thoroughly reviews all open maintenance notifications, carefully assessing the details of each request. They can set the status to ‘In Review’ while the evaluation is in progress.

Following the review, the planner can either ‘Accept’ the notification or ‘Reject’ it if additional information is needed. Accepted notifications are marked ‘Accepted’, while rejected notifications are marked ‘Rejected’ and returned to the originator for follow-up.

Completion Phase

During the Completion phase, the Service Planner informs the Maintenance Planner that issue resolution is in progress and sets the notification status to ‘In Process’.

Once the work is completed, the status is updated to ‘Completed’. The Maintenance Planner then reviews and verifies the information provided. If all details are correct and satisfactory, they set the status to ‘Confirmed’.

This structured approach ensures a smooth, transparent, and accountable process for all parties involved.

 

Action & Statuses

 

Action

Status

Status Method

List of Next Statuses

List of Permitted Previous Statuses

-

Open

Automatic

In Review, Accepted, Rejected

 

Reviewing

In Review

Manual

Accepted, Rejected

Rejected

Accept

Accepted

Manual

Rejected, In Progress, Completed

In Review, Rejected

Reject

Rejected

Manual

In Review, Accepted

In Review, Accepted, In Progress, Completed

Start Work

In Progress

Manual

Rejected, Completed

Accepted

Mark as Complete

Completed

Manual

Confirmed(to be set by operator)

In Progress, Accepted

Confirm

Confirmed

Manual

<None>

Completed

 

Rules

The following rules apply to display the relevant status buttons:

  • When a notification is shared with the service provider only Review and Accept buttons are visible.
  • If the notification is set to In Review, then the said button is disabled.
  • If the notification is accepted, the Review and Accept buttons are disabled.
  • Reject button is always enabled.
  • If the notification is rejected, all the other status buttons are enabled again.
  • The Start Work button is enabled only after the notification is accepted.
  • All the status buttons except Confirm and Reject are disabled once the notification is set to Mark as Complete or Completed state.

 

 

Why it Matters?

Companies must maximize asset utilization to minimize costly downtimes which lead to revenue loss. The SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration solution provides a digital platform to connect operations and the asset management ecosystem for collaborative asset lifecycle management. It enables consistent visibility, transparency and resiliency through a shared platform for work order collaboration with Service Contractors & Suppliers for efficiency and  accuracy from work planning to execution.

The Value of Business Network Asset Collaboration

  • Improve asset data accuracy & completeness- Remove the data silos and collaborating on a common model taxonomy and create a consistent understanding
  • Improve wrench time- Provide centralized access to all maintenance information with continuous collaboration among asset ecosystem partners
  • Reduce maintenance data management costs- Improve efficiency of data handover from asset owners to service providers and reduce data maintenance and validation
  • Reduce unplanned downtime or outages- Enable effective collaboration between the operator and service provider on equipment failures and maintenance performance
  • Improve customer satisfaction- Manage of the full customer lifecycle from maintenance planning, scheduling, execution, and customer service

How do I decide whether this is a solution for me?

  • Do I work with external business partners?

  • Do I want to give access of those partners directly on my ERP?

  • Do I really want to build my own portals and also accept TCO? 

  • Do I have only one level of business partners or it could be many to many relationships?

If you are looking for

A centralized access to all maintenance information with continuous collaboration among asset ecosystem partners (operators / OEMs/ Parts Suppliers/ External Contractors/ Sub-Contractors) without giving access to your ERP. It's as simple as just sending a connection request to get the ball rolling.

Multi-tier connectivity with your partners across the supply chain simplified with multi ERP support and API extensibility.

This is the solution for you.

FAQ's

  • How can I ensure the security of my data on the Network?

You have complete ownership and control of what you share, at what granularity and with whom. Every member on the network has complete transparency and visibility of their data.

  • Could I use this capability even if I have not yet started my S4 transformation?

Yes, we support both ECC & S/4Hana. Here are the details about the supported versions.

  • What if I use 3rd Party solutions? Could I still connect to SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration?

Yes, you can connect using our extensive coverage of REST APIs. Here are the details.

  • Where can I find out more details about SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration?

Here you will find all the relevant details.

  • Where can I find out more details about how Business Network Asset Collaboration fits into Acquire-2-Decommission process?

Here you will find all the relevant details.

  • How can I get started?

Talk to SAP about SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration.

Submit innovation requests

We encourage you to visit the SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration Customer Influence Portal to submit your innovation request...

For further questions and feedback related to the blog, please check the Q&A area and feel free to post your questions in the link with the tag SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration.

We hope you enjoy these new capabilities. Thanks for reading the blog post and Stay tuned!

Follow me on LinkedIn

entry.title: Re: Approach for a multi-site customer service
entry.content:
Hi,

I finally found a solution that works well and allows me to add new sites with different configurations. The steps I followed were:

  • Create a new group similar to the existing ones for Customer Service. Instead of using customersupportagentgroup, create {my_site}customersupportagentrole.
  • Associate this new role with a new backoffice role. Instead of using customersupportagentrole, create a new {my_site}customersupportagentrole.
  • This new backoffice role has authorities: associate it with the OOTB group (e.g., customersupportagentrole).
  • Create a new extension, where we create the perspective-view-switcher with the new role and associate it with the OOTB view.
  • We also create our cs-explorer-tre for the new role.
  • Important: The new group ({my_site}customersupportagentrole) must have permissions for the data types.
  • Once this is done, with the new group, we can customize the screens.

Best regards

entry.title: Understanding the Key Differences Between OData V2 and OData V4 for SAP Integration
entry.content:
OData (Open Data Protocol) is a standard for building and consuming RESTful APIs. It is used extensively in SAP for integrating with various applications and services. OData V2 and OData V4 are two versions of this protocol, each with its own set of features, improvements, and differences.

Here’s a comparison of OData V2 and OData V4 in a table format, specifically focusing on their usage within SAP:

FeatureoData v2oData v4
Specification VersionOData V2 (released in 2012)OData V4 (released in 2014)
ProtocolBased on OData 2.0 specification.Based on OData 4.0 specification.
Metadata FormatXML metadata format (older style)JSON and XML metadata formats (JSON preferred).
Batch ProcessingSupports batch processing but has limitations.More advanced batch processing and more flexible.
Entity SetsLimited to predefined entity sets.Flexible support for entity sets and navigation.
Query OptionsSupports basic query options like $filter, $orderby.Supports more advanced query options like $search, $apply.
Filters and QueriesLimited support for complex filters and queries.Better support for advanced filtering, ordering, and expression.
Complex TypesComplex types are supported, but limited.Enhanced support for complex types and navigation properties.
Type SystemLimited support for data types (Primitive Types).More advanced and flexible data types system (e.g., Geography types).
Key Concepts (Entity/Key)Key concepts like Entity Key, Navigation Properties are similar to V4 but more limited.Supports more complex key concepts and relationships.
Support for Media ResourcesSupports media resources, but with fewer capabilities.Improved handling of media resources (e.g., files, images).
VersioningLimited versioning capabilities.Better versioning support for services.
Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)Basic CORS support.Enhanced support for CORS to better handle cross-domain requests.
Backward CompatibilitySupports backward compatibility with previous versions of OData.Limited backward compatibility with OData V2.
Error HandlingStandard error handling.More granular error handling, with better support for custom error codes.
Service Implementation (SAP)Older SAP systems (SAP Gateway, SAP Netweaver).Modern SAP Cloud Platform, SAP Fiori, SAP S/4HANA, and SAP Cloud Integration.

 

Example: Creating a simple OData service in SAP

OData V2 Example:

  1. Define an OData service in SAP Gateway.
  2. Create Entity Sets for "Customers", "Orders", etc.
  3. Query like:
    GET /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCUSTOMER_SRV/Customers

OData V4 Example:

  1. Define an OData V4 service in SAP (e.g., using SAP Cloud Platform or S/4HANA).
  2. Create Entity Sets and define more flexible navigation paths (e.g., Customers(1)/Orders).
  3. Query like:
    GET /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCUSTOMER_SRV/Customers?$expand=Orders

Key Differences:

  • Versioning & Flexibility: OData V4 has a more flexible query language and allows for more complex queries, such as $expand and $apply for aggregations or transformations.
  • Support for JSON: OData V4 promotes JSON as the primary metadata format, whereas OData V2 is more XML-centric.
  • Error Handling: In OData V4, error handling is more detailed and provides better customization, which is crucial in modern API architectures.

When to Use:

  • OData V2: Suitable for legacy systems or if you are working with older SAP implementations that do not support OData V4.
  • OData V4: Recommended for newer systems like SAP Fiori, SAP S/4HANA, or when you need to leverage advanced features like enhanced filtering, querying, and better error management

RISE with SAP ABAP Development SAP BTP ABAP environment

entry.title: Re: SAP B1/SQL Server 2019 Query Error when entering Para...
entry.content:
In SSMS Work in SAP B1 Not Work

DECLARE @DateFrom DATE
SET @DateFrom = '2025-07-01'
DECLARE @DateTo DATE
SET @DateTo ='2025-08-01'
SELECT
    B.Bo_Pl_No                       AS [WMS No.],
    X.TransferNo                     AS [Transfer No.],
    CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate)   AS [Date],
    P.Tp_ItemCode                    AS [Item No.],
    I.ItemName                       AS [Item Name],
    CAST(P.Tp_Qty AS decimal(19,6))  AS [Quantity],
    B.Bo_No                          AS [Box No.]
FROM dbo.TB_Box B
JOIN dbo.TB_TempPick P ON P.Tp_Box = B.Bo_No
LEFT JOIN OITM I ON I.ItemCode = P.Tp_ItemCode
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT
        COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)), CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50))) AS WMSNo,
        STRING_AGG(CAST(T.DocNum AS nvarchar(20)), ', ') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY T.DocNum) AS TransferNo
    FROM OWTR T
    JOIN NNM1 S ON S.Series = T.Series AND S.ObjectCode = '67'
    WHERE T.CANCELED = 'N'
      AND S.SeriesName LIKE 'ITS%'
    GROUP BY COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)), CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50)))
) X ON CAST(B.Bo_Pl_No AS nvarchar(50)) = X.WMSNo
WHERE
    B.Bo_Active = 1
    AND P.Tp_Active = 1
    AND (@DateFrom IS NULL OR @DateTo IS NULL
         OR (B.Bo_CreateDate >= @DateFrom AND B.Bo_CreateDate < DATEADD(DAY,1,@DateTo)))
ORDER BY
    B.Bo_CreateDate, B.Bo_Pl_No, B.Bo_No, P.Tp_ItemCode;

DECLARE @DateFrom DATE
SET @DateFrom = '[%0]'
DECLARE @DateTo   DATE
SET @DateTo ='[%1]'
SELECT
    B.Bo_Pl_No                       AS [WMS No.],
    X.TransferNo                     AS [Transfer No.],
    CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate)   AS [Date],
    P.Tp_ItemCode                    AS [Item No.],
    I.ItemName                       AS [Item Name],
    CAST(P.Tp_Qty AS decimal(19,6))  AS [Quantity],
    B.Bo_No                          AS [Box No.]
FROM dbo.TB_Box B
JOIN dbo.TB_TempPick P ON P.Tp_Box = B.Bo_No
LEFT JOIN OITM I ON I.ItemCode = P.Tp_ItemCode
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT
        COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)), CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50))) AS WMSNo,
        STRING_AGG(CAST(T.DocNum AS nvarchar(20)), ', ') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY T.DocNum) AS TransferNo
    FROM OWTR T
    JOIN NNM1 S ON S.Series = T.Series AND S.ObjectCode = '67'
    WHERE T.CANCELED = 'N'
      AND S.SeriesName LIKE 'ITS%'
    GROUP BY COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)), CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50)))
) X ON CAST(B.Bo_Pl_No AS nvarchar(50)) = X.WMSNo
WHERE
    B.Bo_Active = 1
    AND P.Tp_Active = 1
    AND (@DateFrom IS NULL OR @DateTo IS NULL
         OR (B.Bo_CreateDate >= @DateFrom AND B.Bo_CreateDate < DATEADD(DAY,1,@DateTo)))
ORDER BY
    B.Bo_CreateDate, B.Bo_Pl_No, B.Bo_No, P.Tp_ItemCode;

entry.title: Re: SPL check in transactions vs Master data transfer.
entry.content:
Why again do we need to do SPL check and Embargo check on Transactions?
- In the documents you see from where to where the transaction goes. So the system will know, if a legal regulation is valid and a block of the BP is relevant (SPL) or a country-block (Embargo)
- You can change address data of Business Partners in a document -> then a new SPL check is necessary, otherwise the system just check, what is in the BP-Master-Data.

Would the GTS system not have already blocked suspicious customer names and embargoed countries ?

- Business Partners are blocked before - you can see this in the Master Data of the BP
- Embargoed countries are checked on transactional level.

entry.title: OpenSource: CPI Edifact <-> XML converter
entry.content:
Inspired by the work of of @engswee (https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/formatconversionbean-arrives-in-cpi/ba-p/13367540) I decided to create a basic edifact to xml converter for use in CPI.

The CPI EDIFACT Converter is a tiny wrapper based on the work by sapstern/edifactconverter, it provides capabillities to convert edifact to xml and back. Since it is based on the work of sapstern it out-of-the-box supports around 70 edifact versions and around 10 000 edifact message types and whenever new edifact standards are released support for them will be added.

The setup is quite basic and requires minimal configuration:

 

To use this package

  1. Download JAR file:

    • Download the JAR files from github.
    • Open the xsd.jar file in 7 Zip and add all the xsd files that you need for your project

  2. Deploy to CPI:

    • Upload the both JAR file to your CPI integration flow as an Archive
    • Add a groovy script step in your iflow.

  3. Groovy Script Example:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import com.cpitoedifact.converter.EdifactConverterFactory

def Message processData(Message message) {

def converter = EdifactConverterFactory.getDefaultConverter()

// Get the message payload
def messageBody = message.getBody(String.class)

// Convert based on message direction
if (message.getHeaders().get("MessageDirection") == "EDIFACT_TO_XML") {
    def xmlResult = converter.convertEdifactToXml(messageBody)
    message.setBody(xmlResult)
} else if (message.getHeaders().get("MessageDirection") == "XML_TO_EDIFACT") {
    def edifactResult = converter.convertXmlToEdifact(messageBody)
    message.setBody(edifactResult)
}

return message;
}

This makes it supereasy to have simple edifact conversions.

https://github.com/tester22/cpi-edifact-converter

entry.title: Deploy an application as container on SAP BTP Kyma runtime
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

We are excited to launch a new series of blogs that will guide you through deploying container-based applications on the SAP BTP Kyma Runtime environment. This series will not only cover the fundamentals of containerization but also provide hands-on insights, best practices, and real-world examples to help you harness the full potential of Kyma for scalable, cloud-native application deployment.

Steps to Enable the Kyma Runtime Environment

  1. Access Your Trial Account

    • Log in to your SAP BTP Trial account.

  2. Create or Open a Subaccount

    • Navigate to your global account.

    • Either open an existing subaccount or create a new subaccount dedicated for Kyma Runtime.

  3. Enable Kyma Runtime

    • In the subaccount, go to the Entitlements section and make sure Kyma Runtime is assigned.

    • Navigate to Kyma Environment and enable the runtime.

    • The setup process may take a few minutes while the environment is being provisioned.

  4. Download the Kubeconfig File

    • Once Kyma is active, download the Kubeconfig URL file.

    • Store it securely and add it to your kyma folder (this will be used to authenticate your local CLI with the Kyma cluster).

Introduction

Looking to take your Spring Boot Eureka application to the next level by deploying it securely and reliably on the Kyma Runtime within SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)? This guide provides a step-by-step walkthrough of the entire lifecycle: from packaging your application as an OCI-compliant container image, pushing it to a trusted container registry, and defining Kubernetes manifests, all the way to deploying it on Kyma. By the end, your Eureka service will be running in a scalable, cloud-native environment, fully integrated with the capabilities of SAP BTP.

Kyma bridges the gap between cloud-native technologies and SAP’s enterprise cloud infrastructure—so mastering these steps will help you build robust solutions that integrate well with SAP BTP.

Prerequisites

Before you start, make sure you have the following in place:

  • An SAP BTP subaccount with the Kyma Runtime enabled.
  • The Kubernetes command-line tool (kubectl) configured with your Kyma cluster (kubeconfig).
  • Docker installed locally.
  • A Docker Hub account (or equivalent OCI registry).
  • A simple SpringBoot eureka app ready (for example, created via the Express generator tutorial).

Step 1: Identify Key Domains and Subdomains

  • From your SAP BTP Cockpit, note down the Subaccount subdomain. This is used later for routing, hostnames, etc.
  • From your kubeconfig.yml file, find the Kyma cluster domain, for example something like *.kyma.shoot.live.k8s-hana.ondemand.com.

These values are needed when you later define the Kubernetes and API routing resources.

 

Step 2: Build Your App into an OCI Image or using docker

You can build Docker-images in many ways, but one of the recommended approaches is to use Cloud Native Buildpacks (CNB), for example via the Paketo Buildpacks.

  • Install the pack CLI tool.

brew install buildpacks/tap/pack

From your application directory, build the image with a command like:

 
pack build <your-dockerhub-account>/my-kyma-app:v1 \ --builder paketobuildpacks/builder-jammy-full​

This takes your source code, applies buildpacks, sets up the runtime image without needing a Dockerfile (unless you need custom behavior).

Using docker, we can use the below command to build an image

docker build -t <repository_name>/<image_name>:<tag> <path_to_dockerfile_context>

Step 3: Push the Image to Docker Hub

Once built, you need to get the image into a container registry that your Kyma cluster can pull from.

Log into Docker:

 
docker login -u <your-Docker-ID> -p <password>​

Push the image:

 
docker push <your-dockerhub-account>/<IMAGE_NAME>:<TAG_NAME>

 

Step 4: Prepare the Deployment Namespace

In your Kyma cluster, it's best to isolate your application in its own namespace (or use existing ones as per your organizational setup).

 
kubectl create namespace my-namespace

Alternatively, this can be done via the Kyma dashboard UI.

 

Step 5: Allow Kyma to Pull Your Image Securely

If your image is in a private registry (or even if public but you want more control), create a Kubernetes secret of type docker-registry. This allows your cluster's nodes / pods to authenticate with Docker Hub.

 
kubectl -n multitenancy-ns create secret docker-registry registry-secret --docker-server=https://index.docker.io/v1/  --docker-username=<docker-id> --docker-password=<password> --docker-email=<email>

or use can use you own docker credential's to pull the image and deploy it on kyma cluster.

docker pull [IMAGE_NAME]:[TAG]

In your Kubernetes deployment manifests, refer to this secret under imagePullSecrets.

Step 6: Define Kubernetes and Kyma Manifests

You’ll need YAML manifest files to define:

  • Deployment: Defines your app pods, container image, resource limits, probes (liveness/readiness), etc.
  • Service: Exposes your pod(s) internally on Kubernetes.
  • APIRule (Kyma Gateway object): Exposes the service externally via the Kyma gateway, defines host, route, and allowed HTTP methods (GET, POST, etc.).
  • NetworkPolicy: (Optional / depending on your security posture) To restrict access, allow only certain ingress, etc.

Here’s a simplified structure of what goes into the k8s-deployment-backend.yaml manifest:

a. Define an APIRule to securely expose your application endpoint to external users.

apiVersion: gateway.kyma-project.io/v2
kind: APIRule
metadata:
  labels:
    app: euraka-application
  name: euraka-application
spec:
  gateway: kyma-system/kyma-gateway
  hosts: 
    - euraka-application
  rules:
    - path: /*
      methods: ["GET", "POST", "PUT", "PATCH"]
      noAuth: true
  service:
    name: euraka-application
    port: 80

 

b. Create a Deployment resource that will orchestrate the rollout and scaling of your application.

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: euraka-application
  name: euraka-application
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: euraka-application
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: euraka-application
        sidecar.istio.io/inject: "true"
    spec:
      imagePullSecrets:
        - name: euraka-application-secret
      containers:
      - env:
        image: <IMAGE_NAME>:<TAG_NUMBER>
        name: euraka-application
        ports:
        - name: http
          containerPort: 8761
          protocol: TCP

 

c. Create a Service resource that routes traffic to your application’s pods and makes it discoverable.

apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  labels:
    app: euraka-application
  name: euraka-application
spec:
  ports:
  - port: 80
    protocol: TCP
    targetPort: 8761
  selector:
    app: euraka-application

Make sure you replace placeholders (account names, namespace, hostnames) with your actual values.

d. Create a NetworkPolicy to manage how your application is exposed and which traffic is allowed.

apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: NetworkPolicy
metadata:
  name: multitenancy
spec:
  ingress:
  - from:
    - namespaceSelector:
        matchLabels:
          kubernetes.io/metadata.name: istio-system
      podSelector:
        matchLabels:
          app: istio-ingressgateway
  podSelector:
    matchLabels:
      release: multitenancy
  policyTypes:
  - Ingress

 

Step 7: Deploy to Kyma Runtime

Once your manifest YAML is ready:

 
kubectl -n my-namespace apply -f deployment.yaml
kubectl -n my-namespace apply -f service.yaml
kubectl -n my-namespace apply -f rule.yaml
kubectl -n my-namespace apply -f network.yaml

This will create the Service, Deployment, APIRule (gateway), etc.

Step 8: Access Your Application

  • In the Kyma Dashboard, navigate to Namespaces → your namespace → find the APIRule or associated Host URL.

  • Copy the external URL enabled by the APIRule’s host field and open it in your browser.

If everything went well, you should see the response your Spring Boot Eureka app sends (could be a "Home Page" or whatever default you configured).

 

Summary

Deploying a Spring Boot Eureka application to Kyma involves a series of well-defined steps that ensure your app is containerized, securely stored, properly exposed, and seamlessly running in a scalable, cloud-native environment. While the process may seem detailed at first, once you’ve gone through it a few times, it becomes a repeatable pattern you can apply with confidence.

By following this flow, you’ll be able to:**

  • Accelerate delivery — move quickly from code to deployment.

  • Ensure consistency — maintain reliable behavior across development, staging, and production environments.

  • Leverage Kyma’s strengths — tap into Kubernetes-native features like autoscaling, intelligent routing, and network/security policies.”**

entry.title: Re: How to display custom MIGO fields in Stock – Multiple...
entry.content:
Hello @Tharma 

You cannot inject MIGO custom fields into the standard Stock – Multiple Materials app. In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the analytical data source of that application does not permit the inclusion of custom fields from the Material Document Item; key-user extensibility is restricted to SAP-provided fields only. SAP Help Portal-Stock - Multiple Materials

Supported approach 

Keep your fields on the Material Document Item using Custom Fields & Logic business context MATERIALDOCUMENTITEM) and enable them for OData/CDS.SAP Help Portal-Extensibility: Material Documents - Read, Create

Build a Custom CDS View that reads I_MaterialDocumentItem now containing your custom fields and joins the master data you need. Mark it analytical (cube). SAP Community-Creating Custom CDS Views and Analytical Query - A step-by-step guide

Create a Custom Analytical Query on that cube and publish it as a Fiori tile (or consume in SAC). SAP Help Portal-Custom Analytical Queries

Should the enterprise need to analyse stock with those attributes, it is advisable to model them at the batch or serial level so they accompany the stock, or alternatively, to generate reports from material document analytics movement-level rather than relying on the stock snapshot application.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Integrated Financial Planning CAPEX Delta Planning Da...
entry.content:
Hi SANA11,

let me add three things:

1) GL Account 16003000 points to depreciation account 64003000:

2) In the FOREACH Loop the statement

DATA([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) +
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA")

makes sure that the sum of the investments in the periodes before is stored in the current period in the variable #CUMMUL_VALUE.

In the example above this is 9000 in period 2

3) In the next loop cycle (period 3), the depreciation is calculated:

9000 * 4% / 12 = 30

entry.title: Re: How to Include Overhead Costs in Product Costing in S...
entry.content:
Hello @MohamedKharbouch,

overhead costs in product cost planning are created via the so called costing sheet. To summarize, the costing sheet consists of 3 parts, a base which contains the cost elements which should be subject to a surcharge, the overhead rate itself, which is in most cases a certain percentage and lastly the credit, which defines which cost center is credited whenever you allocate the overhead costs.

Please also take a look at the following learning page with a comprehensive description: https://learning.sap.com/courses/product-cost-planning-in-sap-s-4hana/applying-overhead-costs-to-a-product

You need to make sure that a costing sheet is assigned in the valuation variant (relevant for your specific plant) of the used costing variant.

By choosing the overhead account in the costing sheet and by assigning this account in the cost component structure to a certain cost component, you can steer if the overheads should be part of the cost of goods manufactured (e.g. material overheads) or the costs of goods sold (e.g. sales and administration overhead charges).

I hope this answers your questions.

Best regards
Marvin

entry.title: Re: VAT code in inboud INVOIC02: Can we override OBCD wit...
entry.content:
Hi,

I know it has been a long time ago, but anyway I will The way I resolved this issue in the intercompany the solution we have come up with.

Basically, we have activate the USEREXIT EXIT_SAPLIEDI_102 which gets triggered by the function module IDOC_INPUT_INVOIC_FI that creates the intercompany invoice. The tax code is stored in the internal structure DOCUMENT_DATA where FNAM is equal to 'BSEG-MWSKZ' and content is the FVAL.

The tax code from the intercompany invoice (IV) can be copied from VBRP using the entry from DOCUMENT_DATA where FNAM = 'BKPF-XBLNR'. The field FVAL contains the invoice number (VBELN).

The internal table DOCUMENT_DATA structured as follow: The field COUNT defines the item line in FB01, however it should read like this:

Count 000001 - Header Data

Count 000002 - First line

Count 000003 - Second line and so one. 

When your copies the tax code from VBRP, it should take this into account. It means first line from VBRP is equal to COUNT = 2, second line is COUNT = 3, then so on. 

Find attached the code for further details.

Best regards

Marcelo Chamon

entry.title: Bank Statement SOAP API - Supplier Invoice Clearing Issue
entry.content:
# Bank Statement SOAP API - Supplier Invoice Clearing Issue

## Problem Description

**Objective:**
Post Bank Statement via ManageBankStatement API (SOAP) and clear corresponding Supplier Invoices.

**What we have implemented:**
1. Business Configuration for Memo Line has been configured
2. Bank Statement posted successfully via ManageBankStatement API (SOAP)

**Problem:**
1. Target Supplier Invoices are not being cleared automatically
2. The G/L Account posted by Supplier Invoice (SIV) differs from the G/L Account posted by Bank Statement
3. **Additional Issue:** Intermediate document shows Payment error: "Review and Clear Bank Statement - XXXX USD" and Journal Entry is not created

**Request:**
Please identify which configuration is incorrect - whether the SOAP API structure is wrong or Business Configuration is incomplete.

---

## Steps to Reproduce

**Step 1:** Create Supplier Invoice (SIV-001, SIV-002) for Business Partner BP001
**Step 2:** Post Bank Statement via ManageBankStatement SOAP API (payload provided below)
**Step 3:** Check if Supplier Invoices are cleared automatically
**Step 4:** **Result:**
- Supplier Invoices remain open (not cleared)
- Payment document shows error: "Review and Clear Bank Statement - XXXX USD"
- Journal Entry is not generated

---

## SOAP API Payload

```xml
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xmlns:glob="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
<soap:Header/>
<soap:Body>
<glob:BankStatementBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
<BankStatement ActionCode="01">
<CompanyID>XX</CompanyID>
<HouseBankAccount>
<ID>1100000001</ID>
</HouseBankAccount>
<DocumentDescription>TEST Bank Statement</DocumentDescription>
<StatementDate>2025-09-18</StatementDate>
<ValidityYear>2025</ValidityYear>
<PostingDate>2025-09-18</PostingDate>
<OpeningBalanceAmount currencyCode="USD">1000000.00</OpeningBalanceAmount>
<ClosingBalanceAmount currencyCode="USD">997000.00</ClosingBalanceAmount>
<DebitTotalAmount currencyCode="USD">3000.00</DebitTotalAmount>
<CreditTotalAmount currencyCode="USD">0.00</CreditTotalAmount>
<ReleaseBankStatement>false</ReleaseBankStatement>
<ItemsTotalNumberValue>2</ItemsTotalNumberValue>

<!-- Item 1: SIV-001 -->
<Item ActionCode="01">
<ItemID>1</ItemID>
<BusinessPartnerInternalID>BP001</BusinessPartnerInternalID>
<ItemDocumentDescription>Inv SIV-001</ItemDocumentDescription>
<BusinessProcessVariantTypeCode>49</BusinessProcessVariantTypeCode>
<PaymentTransactionCategoryCode>15</PaymentTransactionCategoryCode>
<PostedAmount currencyCode="USD">-1500.00</PostedAmount>
<BankValueDate>2025-09-18</BankValueDate>
<BankPostingDate>2025-09-18</BankPostingDate>

<PaymentExplanationItem ActionCode="01">
<ID>1</ID>
<BusinessTransactionDocumentDate>2025-09-18</BusinessTransactionDocumentDate>
<CompanyID>XX</CompanyID>
<BusinessPartnerInternalID>BP001</BusinessPartnerInternalID>
<NetAmount currencyCode="USD">1500.00</NetAmount>

</soap:Envelope>
```

---

## Analysis Questions

1. **G/L Account Determination**: Why do Supplier Invoice posting and Bank Statement posting use different G/L Accounts?

2. **Business Configuration**: Is there missing configuration for:
- BusinessProcessVariantTypeCode (49)
- PaymentTransactionCategoryCode (15)
- Memo Line automatic clearing

3. **Payment Error**: What causes "Review and Clear Bank Statement - XXXX USD" error and prevents Journal Entry creation?

4. **API Structure**: Are the PaymentExplanationItem references structured correctly for automatic clearing?

---

## Environment
- SAP Business ByDesign
- ManageBankStatement SOAP API
- Automatic clearing configuration enabled

Any insights on the root cause and resolution would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: Integrated Financial Planning CAPEX Delta Planning Da...
entry.content:
@hartmut_koernergot it Thank you for your quick response. Another issue is that when I execute the standard content, I'm not receiving any output, and I'm not sure why.

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Set Configurations Definitions for the Advanced Formulas.
//------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/SAP_ALL_COMPANY_CODE], [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_PROFITCENTER]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//The data region against which the formulas will be executed.
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate] TO [d/Version].[p/EndDate]
VARIABLEMEMBER #RESIDUAL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
VARIABLEMEMBER #CUMMUL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Calculation and Data Writing
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
FOREACH [d/Date]
// Staight-Line Depreciation Method: Cummulative Acquisition Value * Depriciation Percentage / 12 Periods
IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_METHOD", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") = 1 THEN
DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA",[d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) *
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_PERCENTAGE", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") / 12
ENDIF
// Accelerated Depreciation Method: Residual Book Value of previous period * Depriciation Percentage / 12 Periods
IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_METHOD", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") = 2 THEN
DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #RESIDUAL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) *
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_PERCENTAGE", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") / 12
ENDIF
// Residual Book Value = Residual Book Value of previous period + Acquisition Value - Depreciation Value
DATA([d/Measures] = #RESIDUAL_VALUE) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #RESIDUAL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) +
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA") -
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount])
// Cummulative Acquisition Value
DATA([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) +
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA")
 
ENDFOR

entry.title: Re: New SAP Build Process Automation content for side-by-side extensions with flexible workflows
entry.content:
@MustafaBensan  I clarified the proposal / guidance. So it is without extension step (you don´t need another workflow, only agent determination asfaiu) with onstack (BAdI) plus Side-by-Side extensibility (SBPA Decision on SAP BTP).

You could implement a custom rule with a BAdI in SAP S/4HANA responsibility management which is used by a flexible workflow definition. Inside the BAdI you can call a REST API. So at runtime creation of workitems agent could be determined by a decision on SBPA, you invoke via the API call in SAP S/4 HANA. There is a small technical restriction: the outbound REST call generates a COMMIT, which can lead to problems in certain scenarios normally rare cases, but must be observed, and is solvable. The Decision needs to modelled and deployed using the SBPA tooling and later invoked via API. Following is the link to the API documentation: https://api.sap.com/api/SPA_Decision/path/invokeRuleServiceVersion

entry.title: How the cost estimation will happen in Campaign orders
entry.content:
I am creating a campaign in PCA1 and adding normal orders with cleanout orders in it. 
Created 3 production version
1. Planning - one recipe and BOM which has all activities and materials needed for both production and cleanout.
2. Production - Has another recipe and BOM with only the activities and materials necessary for producing one batch.
3. Clean out order - Has activities and materials necessary for cleaning (water, solvents, electricity, labor). Will have separate recipe group
Here I need to understand how the standard cost estimate will happen.
Do we need costing done for all Production versions. In standard it allows Standard costing for only one production version.
If costing done only for planning version, will there be no actual cost in Production & Cleanout orders?
Do all the actual cost will be settled as variance.
If so all the cost from cleanout and production order will be settled as variance and loss?
What is the normal business process to handle this.

entry.title: Re: How to export business role template component in mass
entry.content:
Dear customer,

 

Thanks for reaching out.

It is not possible to mass extract component of business role template via the business role template application in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. But as a workaround, you can use the Fiori Apps Library, select the Product Suite as S/4HANA Public Cloud, select Leading Business PFCG Role column and Application Component column in Column Display Settings to display the business role template and component, then click Download button to mass export in excel.

Hope this helps clarify the issue.

 

Best regards,

Jannie

entry.title: How to distinguish the Valuation Class of T stock and E stock in pubulic cloud?
entry.content: In the OP version, if both POD and MTO need to be used simultaneously, there may be conflicts in the Valuation Class, which can be resolved through BADI（MB_SAPLMBME_TKLAS）. What are the better solutions for the public cloud version?

entry.title: SAP Business Network integration to PEPPOL via SAP DRC for Belgium e-Invoicing
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I would like to seek help from our experts here for Ariba Business Network to PEPPOL Integration via SAP DRC. We have completed all the required configuration to integrate PEPPOL to Business Network as below.

1. Configured External Network Identifier in SAP Business Network

2. Uploaded required details in Supplier Master

But we are still not receiving invoices in SAP Business Network via CIG from SAP DRC even though it has been successfully pushed from SAP DRC. We are also not able to see the logs anywhere in CIG and SAP Business Network for the invoices. I am not sure what config is missing here in SAP DRC or SAP Business Network as we don't have much documentation available for Ariba. Request you to please provide your expert inputs if someone already worked on this process to integrate SAP Business Network to PEPPOL.

Regards

Shiv

entry.title: Re: week over week report in SAP analytics cloud

entry.title: SAP EWM - Reprint option throws ABAP Dump
entry.content:
Dear All,

We recently migrated SAP EWM Embedded on premise solution from 1909 to 2303. While testing the 'Reprint' Inbound delivery/Outbound delivery/Warehouse tasks throws ABAP Dump. In the earlier version, the same reprinting functionalities executed without any issues. Please let me know if I need to do any additional config setup?

Thanks

Sakthivel
